intro: Galium verum f. setulosum, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. This variant of Galium verum is distinguished by its hairy stems and is found in parts of Europe and Asia.
